inventory.equipment_text: Chain Mail, Shield, Longsword, Javelins (5), Holy Symbol, Explorer's Pack, Prayer Book, 5 sticks of incense, Vestments, 15 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You speak with calm conviction, rarely raising your voice, and always seeking justice.
roleplay.ideals: Retribution. Those who commit evil must be punished in kind.
roleplay.bonds: Your faith compels you to destroy all who walk in darkness.
roleplay.flaws: You often act without mercy, letting vengeance cloud compassion.
features_and_traits: Divine Sense: As an action, twice per long rest, you can detect good and evil until the end of your next turn (1 + CHA modifier).
Lay on Hands: You have a healing pool of 15 HP. You can use it to heal the wounded or cure disease/poison. Replenishes after a long rest.
Fighting Style: Dueling — When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls.

Divine Smite: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal an extra 2d8 radiant damage (3d8 if it is an undead or a fiend), plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than first.
Divine Health: You are immune to disease.
Channel Divinity: Recharges after a short or long rest. You can use one of the following options: Abjure Enemy, Vow of Enmity.

Abjure Enemy — As an action, present your holy symbol and speak a prayer of denunciation. Choose one creature within 60 feet that you can see. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. Fiends and undead have disadvantage. On a failed save, it is frightened for 1 minute or until it takes damage. On a successful save, the creature's speed is halved for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.
Vow of Enmity — As a bonus action, you can utter a vow of enmity against a creature you can see within 10 feet. For 1 minute, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Celestial, Religion, Insight, Athletics, Intimidation
roleplay.backstory: You were raised in a monastic order devoted to stamping out evil. When the temple fell to dark forces, you took up arms and swore vengeance. Justice became your creed.
roleplay.character_appearance: You carry yourself with rigid discipline, clad in shining armor that gleams with divine purpose. Your stern gaze unnerves the wicked.
roleplay.treasure: An iron holy symbol scorched by demonic fire — a relic from the siege of your temple.

inventory.equipment_text: Chain Mail, Battleaxe, Warhammer, Shield, Dungeoneer's Pack, Insignia of Rank, Set of Dice, 10 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You boast about your battle scars and relish recounting tales of past glories.
roleplay.ideals: Glory. You fight not just to survive, but to earn a place in legend.
roleplay.bonds: Your old squad still holds your loyalty, even after parting ways.
roleplay.flaws: You rush headlong into danger, eager to prove yourself again and again.
features_and_traits: Dwarven Resilience: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance against poison damage.
Stonecunning: When making an Intelligence (History) check related to stonework, you are considered proficient and add double proficiency bonus.
Dwarven Combat Training: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.
Tool Proficiency: You have proficiency with one type of artisan's tools (Smith's Tools).
Fighting Style: Great Weapon Fighting — When you roll damage for an attack you make with a Melee weapon that you are holding with two hands, you can treat any 1 or 2 on a damage die as a 3.
Second Wind: As a bonus action, regain 1d10 + 3 HP once per short rest.
Action Surge: Take an additional action on your turn, once per short rest.
Champion Archetype: Improved Critical — Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Dwarvish, Dice Set, Smith's Tools, Vehicles (Land)
roleplay.backstory: You served for decades in the dwarven army, carving a path through goblin hordes and orc clans. Retirement didn’t stick — the battlefield still calls.
roleplay.character_appearance: You stand solid and squat, your armor battered but well-maintained. A patchwork of scars marks your exposed skin, each one a story.
roleplay.treasure: A drinking horn etched with the names of fallen comrades.

inventory.equipment_text: Leather Armor, Dagger (2), Light Crossbow, Arcane Focus, Disguise Kit, Charlatan's Pack, Forged Documents, 25 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You always smile, even when lying through your teeth.
roleplay.ideals: Freedom. You answer to no one but the voice in your head — your patron.
roleplay.bonds: You seek the power promised by your patron, no matter the cost.
roleplay.flaws: You can't help but show off your magic, even when it draws suspicion.
features_and_traits: Darkvision: You can see in darkness up to 60 feet.
Fey Ancestry: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.
Fiend Patron: Dark One's Blessing — When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier + your warlock level (6).
Pact Magic: You cast warlock spells using Charisma. Your spell slots are regained on a short rest.

Pact Boon: Pact of the Blade — You can use your action to create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form each time you create it. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. Your pact weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.
Eldritch Invocations: In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical ability. Agonizing Blast, Mask of Many Faces:
Agonizing Blast: When you cast Eldritch Blast, add your Charsima Modifier to the damage it deals.
Mask of Many Faces: You can cast Disguise Self at will, without expending a spell slot.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Elvish, Infernal, Disguise Kit, Forgery Kit
roleplay.backstory: You once conned a noble out of their heirloom — only to discover it was a vessel of infernal power. Now a devil whispers in your dreams, and fire dances at your fingertips.
roleplay.character_appearance: You wear stylish, dark clothing with a devil-may-care grin. Firelight seems to cling to your eyes when you speak.
roleplay.treasure: A black opal ring that pulses with infernal heat.

inventory.equipment_text: Leather Armor, Shortsword, Daggers (2), Thieves’ Tools, Disguise Kit, Burglar’s Pack, Set of Dark Clothes, 20 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You always have a cheerful word and a hidden blade.
roleplay.ideals: Freedom. Life’s too short for cages or rules.
roleplay.bonds: You owe a life debt to the guild master who raised you.
roleplay.flaws: You can’t resist showing off, even when it’s risky.
features_and_traits: Lucky: When you roll a 1 on the d20, you can reroll and must use the new roll.
Brave: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
Nimbleness: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.
Sneak Attack: Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage when you hit with a weapon attack and have advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally.
Thieves' Cant: You know thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation.
Expertise: You gain expertise with two skills (Stealth, Sleight of Hand), doubling your proficiency bonus for ability checks with those skills.

Cunning Action: As a bonus action, you can Dash (gain extra movement equal to your speed), Disengage (your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks for the rest of the turn), or Hide (make a stealth check in an attempt to hide. Successfully hidden creatures have advantage on attack rolls, and attack rolls against them have disadvantage).

Assassin Archetype: Assassinate — You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in the combat yet. In addition, any hit you score against a creature that is surprised is a critical hit.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Halfling, Thieves' Cant, Thieves’ Tools, Disguise Kit
roleplay.backstory: You grew up on the streets, learning how to slip a purse or vanish into shadows. But your latest contract has made you wonder who’s really pulling the strings.
roleplay.character_appearance: You are small and nimble, dressed in muted greys and blacks. A glint in your eye and quick fingers make you both endearing and dangerous.
roleplay.treasure: An enchanted cloak clasp that muffles your footsteps when moving fast.

inventory.equipment_text: Quarterstaff, Dagger, Spellbook, Arcane Focus, Scholar’s Pack, Robes, 15 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You are eerily calm when speaking about death and decay.
roleplay.ideals: Knowledge. Understanding the forces of life and death brings control.
roleplay.bonds: Your master died under mysterious circumstances. You seek the truth.
roleplay.flaws: You often prioritize study over people’s lives.
features_and_traits: Darkvision: You can see in darkness up to 60 feet.
Keen Senses: You have proficiency in Perception.
Fey Ancestry: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

Arcane Recovery: Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your wizard level, rounded up (2 — you can recover either a 2nd-level spell slot or two 1st-level slots).

Necromancy School: Grim Harvest — Once per turn when you kill one or more creatures with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain hit points equal to twice the spell's level, or three times its level if the spell belongs to the School of Necromancy. You don't gain this benefit for killing constructs or undead.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Elvish, Draconic, Arcana, History, Insight, Investigation
roleplay.backstory: You were once a scholar at an arcane academy, but your obsession with death magic got you expelled. Now, you chase forbidden knowledge in crypts and catacombs.
roleplay.character_appearance: You are thin and elegant, dressed in deep gray robes. A skeletal motif runs through your accessories, from your brooch to your boots.
roleplay.treasure: A withered hand suspended in amber — the key to a lost necromancer’s sanctum.

inventory.equipment_text: Chain Mail, Shield, Mace, Light Crossbow, Holy Symbol, Priest’s Pack, Vestments, 10 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You offer comfort easily, but privately question whether faith can fix everything.
roleplay.ideals: Compassion. Healing others is both a gift and a responsibility.
roleplay.bonds: You lost someone dear and now strive to save others from the same fate.
roleplay.flaws: You struggle to reconcile your deity's will with your own moral compass.
features_and_traits: Channel Divinity: You can use your Channel Divinity to fuel magical effects. You can use 1 per long rest. Turn Undead, Preserve Life:

Turn Undead — As an action, present your holy symbol and speak a prayer. Each undead within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move away from you, and can't willingly move within 30 feet of you. It can't take reactions and can only use the Dash action.

Preserve Life — As an action, you present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to five times your cleric level (15). Choose any creatures within 30 feet of you, and divide those hit points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. You can’t use this feature on an undead or a construct.
Disciple of Life — Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell’s level.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Celestial, Medicine, Insight, Religion, Persuasion
roleplay.backstory: You once served as a field medic for a missionary order. You’ve seen miracles and tragedies, and now you wander to bring both hope and healing.
roleplay.character_appearance: You carry a worn holy symbol over your chest and wear a peaceful expression even amid chaos. Your armor is polished but well-used.
roleplay.treasure: A broken charm bracelet from a child you couldn’t save.

inventory.equipment_text: Component Pouch, Dagger, Traveler’s Clothes, Explorer’s Pack, Fire-scarred journal, 12 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You are quick-tempered but fiercely loyal to those who earn your trust.
roleplay.ideals: Freedom. You won't be shackled by fate or blood.
roleplay.bonds: You search for the truth behind your draconic heritage and the fires it awakened.
roleplay.flaws: You often lash out with your magic before thinking.
features_and_traits: Darkvision: You can see in darkness up to 60 feet.
Hellish Resistance: Resistance to fire damage.
Infernal Legacy: You know the thaumaturgy cantrip. At 3rd level, you can cast hellish rebuke as a 2nd-level spell (without expending a spell slot) once per long rest.
Draconic Bloodline: Elemental Affinity (Fire) — Add CHA modifier to fire spell damage.

Sorcery Points: You tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself. This wellspring is represented by sorcery points. You have 3 sorcery points. You can spend these points to create spell slots or use metamagic:

Creating spell slots: You can transform sorcery points into one spell slot as a bonus action on your turn. 2 sorcery points create a 1st level spell slot, and 3 sorcery points create a 2nd level spell slot. Any spell slot created with this feature vanishes when you finish a long rest.

Metamagic: Distant Spell — When you cast a spell that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double the range of the spell. When you cast a spell that has a range of touch, you can spend 1 point to make the range 30 feet.
Metamagic: Empowered Spell — When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Charisma modifier (3). You must use the new rolls.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Infernal, Draconic, Survival, Deception, Arcana
roleplay.backstory: You grew up in the wilds, hiding from villagers who feared your horns and the flames that danced at your fingertips. One day, your powers surged uncontrollably — and now you seek answers.
roleplay.character_appearance: You have crimson skin, golden eyes, and curling white horns. Heat seems to ripple in your wake when you're angry.
roleplay.treasure: A cracked dragon-scale talisman that glows faintly when you cast fire spells.

inventory.equipment_text: Greataxe, Handaxes (2), Explorer’s Pack, Trophy from a past kill, Traveler’s Clothes, 10 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You speak little and fight hard, preferring action to words.
roleplay.ideals: Strength. You survive by crushing your obstacles.
roleplay.bonds: You carry the guilt of those you couldn’t protect during a raid.
roleplay.flaws: You often mistake violence for the only solution.
features_and_traits: Darkvision: You can see in darkness up to 60 feet.
Relentless Endurance: When reduced to 0 HP but not killed outright, drop to 1 HP instead (once per long rest).
Savage Attacks: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage.

Rage: On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action and can rage 3 times per long rest. While raging, you gain +2 damage on melee weapon attacks, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws. Your rage lasts for 1 minute, ending early if you are knocked unconscious.
Reckless Attack: You throw aside all concern for defense and attack with fierce desperation. You gain advantage on melee attacks but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.
Danger Sense: You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see.

Berserker Path: Frenzy — You can go into a frenzy when you rage. For the duration of your rage you can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns. When your rage ends, you suffer 1 level of exhaustion (disadvantage on ability checks).
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Orc, Nature, Survival, Athletics, Intimidation
roleplay.backstory: Once part of a nomadic tribe, you lost your kin in a brutal betrayal. Since then, rage has fueled your every battle, a fire you cannot quench. None remain from your tribe.
roleplay.character_appearance: You tower over most, with a massive frame, green-gray skin, and haunted eyes. Old scars cross your chest like stories left unfinished.
roleplay.treasure: A necklace of teeth from those you've slain — with one spot waiting for the betrayer.

inventory.equipment_text: Chain Mail, Shield, Warhammer, Holy Symbol, Light Crossbow, Priest’s Pack, 15 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You bellow prayers like battle cries and march like thunder.
roleplay.ideals: Order. Storms bring chaos, and only through structure can they be mastered.
roleplay.bonds: You owe your life to the god of storms — and you won’t let them down.
roleplay.flaws: You have little patience for those who doubt your faith or power.
features_and_traits: Darkvision: You can see in darkness up to 60 feet.
Dwarven Resilience: Advantage on saves vs. poison and resistance to poison damage.

Tempest Domain: Wrath of the Storm — When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to make a Dex saving throw. The creature takes 2d8 lightning or thunder damage on a failed save, and half as much on a success. Use 3 times per long rest.
Channel Divinity: You can use your Channel Divinity to fuel magical effects. You can use 1 per long rest. Turn Undead, Destructive Wrath:

Turn Undead — As an action, present your holy symbol and speak a prayer. Each undead within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move away from you, and can't willingly move within 30 feet of you. It can't take reactions and can only use the Dash action.
Destructive Wrath — When you roll lightning or thunder damage, you can deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Dwarvish, Celestial, Religion, Insight, Medicine, Intimidation
roleplay.backstory: You were struck by lightning as a child and lived — ever since, storms have answered your prayers. Now, you wander to carry your deity’s storm to the faithless.
roleplay.character_appearance: You are squat and broad, with a beard braided in copper rings. Static crackles around your holy symbol when you raise your voice.
roleplay.treasure: A shard of glass fused into a lightning-shaped arc — all that remains of your childhood home.

inventory.equipment_text: Studded Leather Armor, Longbow, Shortswords (2), Explorer’s Pack, Quiver of 20 arrows, Hunting Trap, 18 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You speak little, but when you do, your words carry weight.
roleplay.ideals: Balance. Nature holds all truths, if you know where to look.
roleplay.bonds: You have spent years hunting a great beast that destroyed your village. You still pursue it.
roleplay.flaws: You find it hard to trust civilization or cities.
features_and_traits: Darkvision: You can see in darkness up to 60 feet.
Fey Ancestry: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.
Favored Enemy: Beasts — you have advantage on Survival checks to track them and Intelligence checks to recall info.
Natural Explorer: Forest — you're skilled at navigating and surviving in this terrain.
Fighting Style: Archery — You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
Hunter Archetype: Colossus Slayer — once per turn, deal an extra 1d8 damage to a creature below its hit point maximum.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Elvish, Sylvan, Nature, Survival, Perception, Stealth, Investigation
roleplay.backstory: You grew up in the forest, raised among rangers and druids. When darkness crept into your homeland, you became a silent guardian.
roleplay.character_appearance: You move with grace, clothed in greens and browns that blend with foliage. Your eyes pierce the gloom like twin emeralds.
roleplay.treasure: A carved wooden whistle that summons a hawk companion.

inventory.equipment_text: Rapier, Light Crossbow, Entertainer’s Pack, Lute, Disguise Kit, Costume, 25 gp

roleplay.personality_traits: You collect tales and songs, whether inspiring or horrific.
roleplay.ideals: Creativity. Art and story can change the world.
roleplay.bonds: You’re writing an epic about your adventures and those you travel with.
roleplay.flaws: You embellish stories too much, even when accuracy matters.
features_and_traits: Bardic Inspiration (d6): You can inspire others through stirring words or music. As a bonus action, grant an ally 1d6 to add to ability check, attack roll, or saving throw. You can use this feature 3 times per long rest.
Jack of All Trades: Add half proficiency bonus to any ability check not already proficient.

Song of Rest: you can use soothing music to help revitalize your wounded allies during a short rest. If you or any friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain hit points by spending Hit Dice at the end of the short rest, each of those creatures regains an extra 1d6 hit points.

College of Lore: Cutting Words — you learn how to use your wit to distract, confuse, and otherwise sap the confidence and competence of others. When a creature that you can see within 60 feet makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a damage roll, you can use your reaction to expend one of your uses of Bardic Inspiration, rolling 1d6 and subtracting the number rolled from the creature’s roll.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Elvish, Draconic, Lute, Disguise Kit, History, Performance, Insight, Persuasion
roleplay.backstory: From taverns to royal courts, you’ve sung and deceived with equal grace. Your songs hide secrets — and sometimes truths people aren't ready to hear.
roleplay.character_appearance: You wear layered fabrics of bold colors, with a lute slung across your back and a mischievous twinkle in your eye.
roleplay.treasure: A magically bound book that transcribes any song or tale you perform.

inventory.equipment_text: Scimitar, Shield, Leather Armor, Druid's Pack, Herbalism Kit, Wooden Staff, 10 gp, Simple Robes, Component Pouch

roleplay.personality_traits: You find peace in the quiet moments of nature, and you speak for those who cannot speak for themselves.
roleplay.ideals: Nature. The natural world is more important than all the constructs of civilization.
roleplay.bonds: You are the guardian of an ancient grove that has been in your family for generations.
roleplay.flaws: You are slow to trust those who do not show respect for nature.
features_and_traits: Darkvision: You can see in darkness up to 60 feet.
Fey Ancestry: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.
Trance: You don't need to sleep. Instead, you meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day.
Druidic: You know Druidic, the secret language of druids. You can speak the language and use it to leave hidden messages.

Wild Shape: Twice per long rest, you can use your action to magically assume the shape of a beast that you have seen before. You can use this feature twice. Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but you retain your personality, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. When you transform, you assume the beast's hit points. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed.
Circle of the Moon: You gain the ability to use Wild Shape on your turn as a bonus action, rather than as an action. You can also transform into more dangerous animal forms.
roleplay.proficiencies_and_languages: Common, Elvish, Druidic, Herbalism Kit, Nature, Animal Handling, Medicine, Survival
roleplay.backstory: You were raised in the depths of an ancient forest, learning the ways of nature from the elder druids of your circle. Your connection to the wild has grown stronger with each passing season.
roleplay.character_appearance: You move with the grace of a forest creature, your green eyes reflecting the wisdom of ancient trees. Your brown hair is adorned with small leaves and flowers that seem to bloom naturally.
roleplay.treasure: A staff carved from the heartwood of the oldest tree in your grove, said to contain the spirit of the forest itself.
